author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, on Tuesday, launched a mobile ambient air quality monitoring station set up at a cost of Rs. 1.25 crore. The mobile station has equipment that can monitor sulphur dioxide (SO2), oxides of nitrogen, ground level ozone (O3), particulate matter of 2.5 microns and 10 microns sizes, benzene, toluene and xylene.

It also has a weather monitoring equipment that will record humidity, wind velocity, temperature and wind direction. The mobile station would be utilised to monitor pollution levels during Deepavali and Pongal festivals, and during industrial accidents and fires at garbage dumping sites.
title: Monitoring air quality on the go
